author: Rohith Nair
title: Iraq stun Japan to seal Asian Cup last-16 spot
text:
AL RAYYAN, Qatar - Iraq claimed their first victory over Japan in 42 years when they won their Asian Cup Group D encounter 2-1 on Friday to qualify for the knockout stage thanks to a first-half double from Aymen Hussein at the Education City Stadium.
Japan were unbeaten against the West Asian side in their last nine games and Iraq's victory propelled them to the top of the group standings with six points from two games.
Hajime Moriyasu's side have three points, the same as Indonesia who beat Vietnam 1-0 in the other Group D game.
"Today is a great day for Iraqi people but for us it's just a win. We have six points, but the players must now think of Vietnam (in the last group game) and they need to rest," Iraq coach Jesus Casas told reporters.
"I'm very proud of my players. All Iraqi players should be proud... The perfect match is impossible, but we were close to the perfect match I wanted."
Roared on by thousands of Iraqi supporters in the stadium, Iraq got on the board inside five minutes when Japan goalkeeper Zion Suzuki failed to deal with a cross, parrying the ball straight to Hussein who headed it into the top corner.
Iraq's strategy to unsettle Japan was to stay compact and use their physicality early on, which worked to an extent until the East Asian side began using their pace and finding space on the wings to put crosses into the box.
Japan had a golden opportunity to equalise in the 22nd minute from a set piece when a header fell to Wataru Endo at the edge of the six-yard box, but the skipper was unable to direct an overhead kick into the net.
Iraq doubled their lead on the stroke of halftime when Ahmed Al-Hajjaj skipped past his marker and floated in a cross that was headed home from point-blank range by Hussein.
PENALTY DENIED
But Hussein went down injured just before the break and was replaced for the second half and though Iraqi fans were dejected when their hero did not take the field, they found their voice again when Japan were denied a penalty despite a VAR check.
Moriyasu made five substitutions after the restart but the Samurai Blue rarely tested the keeper until the 94th minute when Endo headed home at the far post from a corner.
The atmosphere was tense in the dying minutes as Japan frantically sought an equaliser but Iraq held on for the three points to move top.
"We prepared the same way as we did for Vietnam but unfortunately we found ourselves in a difficult position, especially early on. The crowd and atmosphere made us feel like we were playing an away game," Moriyasu said.
"The second goal hit us hard, we must learn from our mistakes. The players fought hard and I must accept responsibility for the loss.
"We analysed before the game and knew how Iraq would play at the start, they did play very aggressive. Unfortunately we couldn't handle it, I know we need to do more."
Indonesia moved up to third after Asnawi Mangkualam scored from the spot in the 42nd minute after they won a penalty when defender Nguyen Thanh Binh pulled Rafael Struick's shirt and hauled him down in the box.
Mangkualam stepped up and sent the keeper the wrong way to score. Vietnam also had Le Pham Thanh Long sent off for a second yellow card in the 91st minute.
(Reporting by Rohith Nair in Doha; Editing by Ken Ferris and Toby Davis)

author: Jillian Delaney
title: Local officials help JCC’s new Early Childhood Center avoid two-week delay in opening - silive.com
text: STATEN ISLAND, N.Y. — Sen. Jessica Scarcella-Spanton (D-North Shore/South Brooklyn) worked with other elected officials to get the JCC’s new Early Childhood Center open after the center faced yet another potential delay. “As a parent of two young children, I understand firsthand how crucial access to childcare is,” said Scarcella-Spanton. “It was important to me that we resolved the issue as soon as possible. The JCC’s Early Childhood Center is an essential resource for local families, and I am proud to have worked in ensuring it opens as soon as possible.” The center —which can be found at Temple Israel — was initially supposed to open on the first day of school. A halt of the center’s opening came from the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, according to a written statement, “leaving 70 North Shore families scrambling for alternate plans.” When alerted about the issue, the senator and Councilwoman Kamillah Hanks (D-North Shore) worked with the necessary city departments and agencies to get the center up and running before another two-week delay, including the Department of Health, the FDNY, and the Office of Children and Family Services. “This success highlights the power of collaboration between city and state officials. By working closely with the FDNY and the NYC Department of Health, my office was able to fast-track the approvals needed to ensure the JCC’s Early Childhood Center could open in a timely manner. It took coordinated efforts across multiple agencies to overcome the hurdles that could have delayed the opening by weeks. The teamwork between my office, and local elected officials made it possible for us to cut through the red tape, expedite background checks, and secure the necessary approvals, all within a tight timeframe. This was truly a team effort, and I’m proud of what we accomplished together for the families in our community,” Kamillah Hanks said. JCC CEO Orit Lender said, “I am incredibly grateful for the support of our local elected officials who worked hard behind the scenes to make this happen. We received support from the governor and mayor’s offices, Senator Scarcella-Spanton, Assembly Member Pirozzolo, Borough President Fossella, and Council Member Hanks in pushing the city and state to allow us to open. Our partner organization UJA-Federation of NY was also a huge help in moving the process along. Without all of their support, we would not have been able to open this week. It was incredible to see the smiling faces of the children and parents as they entered their new school for the first time.”

author: Decatur Daily Democrat
title: Seamless Travel: India Online Visa Welcomes Colombian, Azerbaijani, Barbadian, and Belarusian Citizens | News | decaturdailydemocrat.com
text: Celebrating its abundant cultural heritage and varied landscapes, India joyfully declares the broadening of its online visa initiative to encompass individuals from Colombia, Azerbaijan, Barbados, and Belarus. This expansion signifies a noteworthy stride in advancing cultural interchange and nurturing robust international connections. The Indian E-Visa initiative enables citizens of these countries to secure travel authorization for diverse reasons, spanning tourism, business, medical visits, and beyond. India endeavors to provide a more seamless and easily accessible avenue for individuals from these nations to delve into the nation's historical wonders, lively traditions, and awe-inspiring natural wonders by simplifying the visa application process. INDIAN VISA FOR COLOMBIA CITIZENS Since 2014, the Indian government has provided an online visa application form for citizens of Colombia. The India visa is now accessible in 169 countries worldwide and has played a pivotal role in boosting India's tourism economy in recent times. With the introduction of Indian visas for Colombia citizens , they can now engage in travel for leisure, business, or medical purposes, with the entire process conveniently completed online. Currently, there are three types of India e-Visas, each featuring distinct validity periods and entry requirements. Notably, the India Tourist e-Visa is designed for visiting friends and family or attending yoga retreats. Valid for one year, it permits two entries into India, with a maximum stay of 90 days on each entry. The Business e-visa for working in India covers activities like business meetings, sales or exchanges, tour guiding, recruitment, or conference participation, among others. This visa allows double entry for a maximum of 180 days and is valid for one year. Additionally, the Medical visa for India caters to travelers seeking short-term medical treatment, allowing a maximum stay of 60 days and permitting three entries. The online application form is user-friendly and can be completed from any location worldwide in just 10 minutes. INDIAN VISA FOR AZERBAIJAN CITIZENS Similar to numerous other nations, the Indian government extends the provision of an e-Visa to Azerbaijani citizens, enabling them to seek electronic travel authorization for various purposes. Azerbaijanis are eligible to travel to India for leisure, business, or medical treatment through this electronic visa system. Since 2014, Azerbaijani nationals have had the opportunity to apply for an electronic visa specifically for India. For leisure purposes, some citizens may opt for the government-issued India Tourist e-Visa, which allows a visit for up to 30 days, primarily intended for sightseeing and other recreational activities. This visa permits two entries during its validity period. Alternatively, those holding an e-business visa can enter India for a total duration of 365 days, with a maximum stay of 180 days, specifically for business visits or commercial activities within the country and not for employment purposes. Furthermore, the E-Medical Visa is tailored for individuals seeking medical treatment in India, permitting a stay of up to 60 days. This encompasses medical activities such as yoga, physical therapy, complex anatomy procedures, or treatment of various illnesses. Azerbaijani citizens can conveniently obtain an Indian Visa from the comfort of their homes, with the prerequisite of preparing the necessary documents before applying for the Indian e-Visa. INDIAN VISA FOR BARBADOS CITIZENS Few countries in the world leave an enduring impression on visitors like India. India has more layers of history and civilization than any other country. To visit India for nearly any reason, Barbadians can apply for an Indian e-Visa. Citizens of over 169 countries can apply for these e-Visas for India. Since 2014, the Indian government has made an online application form for Indian visas for Barbadians available. The India e-Visa is a legal document that allows Barbadian nationals to travel to India for leisure, business, and other purposes. Tourist Electronic Visa: This e-Visa is valid in India for vacations, sightseeing, and other tourism-related activities. This visa only allows for multiple entrances, and travelers can stay for up to 30 days in total. There are two long-term e-Visas issued by the Government of India that allow Barbadians to enter the country frequently. The 1-year and 5-year electronic tourist visas allow multiple entries into the country for 1 year and 5 years, with each stay not exceeding 90 days. e-Business Visa – If they hold this type of visa, they are allowed to enter India for a total of 365 days with a limit of 180 days for each stay. However, this visa category cannot be used for employment purposes. Electronic Medical Visa: This can be used if they need medical treatment such as physical therapy, complex anatomy, or curing of diseases in India.They have a maximum stay of 60 days in India, with three entry permits during that period. Citizens of Barbados who meet the visa requirements can apply for an Indian e-Visa. Indian Visa Application for Barbados Citizens is a simple process that can be completed from anywhere. INDIAN VISA FOR BELARUS CITIZENS Belarusians, armed with an internet-connected computer or smartphone, possess the flexibility to apply for an Indian e-Visa from any location. This visa option is open to citizens of more than 169 countries, Belarus included. Similar to individuals from various nations, Belarusians have the opportunity to seek an India e-Visa by applying to the Indian government. Since 2014, the Indian government has facilitated an online application form for Belarusian citizens seeking Indian visas. This development opens the door for Belarusians to travel to India for diverse reasons, encompassing tourism, business engagements, and medical care. The Tourist e-Visa is specifically designed for tourism-related activities such as travel and sightseeing, allowing a stay of up to 30 days with the possibility of returning. Additionally, there are extended options with 1-year and 5-year tourist e-Visas, providing Belarusian citizens the flexibility to stay in India for more extended periods. For those engaged in business activities, the E-Business Visa permits entry into the Republic of India for a total duration of 365 days, with each stay capped at 180 days. This visa is suitable for business trips or commercial activities within the country but not for employment purposes. The E-Medical Visa caters to those seeking medical treatment in India, including activities like yoga, physical therapy, complex medical procedures, or disease treatment, allowing a stay of up to 60 days with three entries. Once equipped with all the necessary documents, Belarusians can initiate the India e-Visa Application Form to facilitate their travel plans. Media Contact Company Name: INDIAN EVISA Official Government Immigration Visa Application Online Contact Person: Mary Windham Caitlin Email: Send Email Country: India Website: india-visa-online.org/visa/

En 1912, China tomó legalmente el nombre de República de China, tras el derrocamiento de la monarquía. En 1949, al finalizar la guerra civil, el Partido Nacionalista fue desplazado por el Partido Comunista de la mayor parte del territorio chino, quedando limitado al territorio del archipiélago de Taiwán, con el nombre de República de China, mientras que el resto del país tomó el nombre de República Popular de China.
Igual así lo entiendes ,aunque tengo mis dudas.
En 1931,España tomó legalmente el nombre de República española , tras el derrocamiento de la monarquía. En 1939, al finalizar la guerra civil, el Partido republicano fue desplazado por el Partido Fascista de la mayor parte del territorio español, quedando limitado al territorio del archipiélago de canarias, con el nombre de República despañola, mientras que el resto del país tomó el nombre de EspaÑa.
Los aborígenes de Taiwán, denominados yuanzhumin en la República de China (
https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rep%C3%BAblica_de_China) (en chino ( https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idioma_chino), 原住民; pinyin ( https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinyin), yuánzhùmín, taiwanés: gôan-chū-bîn, "habitantes originarios"), o gaoshan en la República Popular China ( https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rep%C3%BAblica_Popular_China) (chino https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idioma_chino: 高山族; pinyin https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinyin: Gāoshān zú), es el nombre genérico que reciben los aborígenes de las zonas montañosas de la isla de Taiwán ( https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isla_de_Taiw%C3%A1n).

[#45](c45#c-45) Pues tendrán que seguir cuestinandolo.
La monarquía de Australia es la institución en la que una persona ejerce como soberano y jefe de Estado de Australia, de forma hereditaria. La monarquía australiana es una monarquía constitucional, inspirada en el sistema de gobierno parlamentario de Westminster, aunque incorpora características propias de la Constitución de Australia.
El monarca actual es Carlos III, con el título de rey de Australia,[1] cuyo reinado comenzó el 8 de septiembre de 2022, tras el fallecimiento de la reina Isabel II. Es representado en el conjunto de Australia por el gobernador general, de acuerdo con la Constitución australiana[2] y las cartas patentes del rey,[3][4][5] y en cada uno de los estados australianos, según las constituciones estatales, por un gobernador, asistido por un vicegobernador.

[#49](c49#c-49) Gran Bretaña "perdió" a Australia, Irlanda o la India hace décadas. Y lo han aceptado. Si mañana Australia decide convertirse en una república, la reacción del Reino Unido será encogerse de hombros.
China "perdió" Taiwan también hace décadas. Pero, como su gobierno es una dictadura carente de legitimidad, hay que distraer a los pipis de ese hecho. Y han recurrido a un clásico: el nacionalismo.
[#50](c50#c-50) El imperio Británico abandonósalio por patas desde el siglo XVIII sus colonias norteamericas desde 1786 y mantuvieron el pataleo en Región Administrativa Especial de Hong Kong de la República Popular China hasta 1997 .
Diferencias notables
Hong Kong y Taiwán eran chinas por historia, vecindad geográfica geograficod de mientras Inglaterra sus vecinos geográficos son los Europeos y el resto es el negocio colonial de la compañía de las Indias y sus productos a expoliar.
Y china no perdió Taiwan. EEUU como líder del anticomunismo monto su tenderete a cambio de protección pero la China está reconocida desde 1971 como único representante de China y sus territorios.
https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong
https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resoluci%C3%B3n_2758_de_la_Asamblea_General_de_las_Naciones_Unidas
[#51](c51#c-51) Varias cosas:
a) ¿Crees que me estás diciendo algo sobre Hong Kong que yo no supiera?
b) Vaya, parece que, de repente, Australia se caído de la discusión.
c) Taiwan lleva funcionando 70 años como país un independiente, igual que Australia, sin importar las ficciones que todos los países del mundo hayan decidido mantener para no cabrear a los chinos. Y la mayoría de los taiwaneses no quieren ni oír hablar de formar parte de China. En parte, por lo que ha ocurrido en Hong Kong en los últimos años.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:Political_repression_in_Hong_Kong
[#52](c52#c-52) Me imagino que los aborígenes australianos ,los indios norteamericanos .....
tampoco quieren saber nada de los ingleses y llevan más de 70 años.
Como argumento para tu gran conocimiento se qué un poco corto.
Las leyes internacionales son para cumplirlas aunque el Sáhara lleva esperando décadas y los chinos También.
Y la discusión no era sobre Australia era solo un ejemplo de las varas de medir de tu mundo colonial blanco que defiendes y los problemas que le ponen a China para recuperar parte de su territorio.
Y como ya te informe Carlos III es rey de Austria que eso fue el comienzo del tema que ignorabas, recuerdas.
España también puede dejar de ser una monarquía ,pero es una monarquía.
Titular bastante amarillista, la verdad:
"Biden: Not ruling out using US military force. There’s a distinction between deploying on the ground, air power and naval power, etc. "
De hecho leyendo la entrevista completa da la sensación de que precisamente tropas, no. Ah!, y que siguen reconociendo la idea de One China.

author: @francophileenoz
title: Queensland Women Drown in Gympie Stormwater Drain | The Advocate | Burnie, TAS
text: Two Queensland women who drowned in a stormwater drain following wild weather conditions have been identified as 46-year-old Tanya Hehir and 40-year-old Helen Bradford. The women were exploring a 2.4km drain called the "love tunnel" in Gympie with a friend when they were swept away by floodwaters. Their companion, a 46-year-old woman made it to safety and contacted police. Emergency services were called to the Kidd Bridge around 3.20pm. A search and rescue operation commenced involving water police, general duties officers, swift water rescue crews and the SES. Police first recovered Helen Bradford's body at 7:10pm on Boxing Day and Tanya Hehir's body on December 27. Tanya Hehir was a keen runner and a member of the Gympie Hash House Harriers. Gympie Regional Council mayor Glen Hartwig told the ABC that he would consider new safety measures in light of the tragedy. "It's an old stormwater system that's been there since the foundation of Gympie," he said. "It's not a place to be played with. It's not a place where you want to go and explore." Acting superintendent Paul Algie said in recent times that weather events were developing quickly and advised the public to be careful near water. "There is always the chance tragedy can strike," he said. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date. We care about the protection of your data. Read our [Privacy Policy](/privacy/).

author: Rubén Márquez
title: Han creado la Santísima Trinidad de las baterías. Un grupo de científicos han conseguido unir tres tecnologías imposibles de mezclar hasta ahora
text: Que el litio se ha convertido en un problema para nuestra sociedad hace mucho que dejó de ser noticia. Por su escasez, contaminación y varapalo económico, la búsqueda de alternativas para alimentar de energía a nuestros móviles, portátiles, vehículos, y otra ingente cantidad de cacharros de la que a menudo no somos conscientes, se ha convertido en una necesidad imperante. [Avances en el mundo de la energía](https://www.3djuegos.com/3djuegos-trivia/noticias/japon-ha-descubierto-que-clave-para-mejorar-energia-baterias-estaba-aumenta-nuestra-buen-chute-cafeina) como el de esta nueva batería, en cambio, pintan un futuro mucho más esperanzador. Tal y como recogía Grayson Deysher de la Universidad de San Diego en los comentarios del paper publicado en [Nature Energy](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41560-024-01569-9), "aunque ha habido baterías de sodio, de estado sólido y sin ánodo anteriormente, nadie ha podido combinar con éxito estas tres ideas hasta ahora". Al [deshacerse del litio](https://www.3djuegos.com/3djuegos-trivia/noticias/bateria-que-se-recarga-segundos-investigadores-han-descubierto-forma-crear-pilas-eficientes-duraderas-gracias-a-iones-sodio) y valerse del sodio, estamos ante un salto revolucionario. Una prometedora alternativa a las baterías y pilas de litio Al fin y al cabo lo que ha conseguido el equipo de la profesora Shirley Meng, junto a los [científicos de la Universidad de Chicago](https://pme.uchicago.edu/news/uchicago-prof-shirley-mengs-laboratory-energy-storage-and-conversion-creates-worlds-first) y la Universidad de California, es abrirnos las puertas a una nueva batería de estado sólido de sodio sin ánodo capaz de ofrecer alta capacidad y carga rápida sin tener que lidiar con las cada vez más preocupante escasez del litio. Y eso por no hablar del precio. De la mano de una innovadora arquitectura, tal y como recoge Deysher, el avance supone que las baterías de estado sólido de sodio puedan verse como una alternativa. "Esperamos que este artículo pueda estimular más avances en el campo del sodio al demostrar que puede funcionar bien, incluso mejor que la versión de litio en algunos casos". La gran baza, en cualquier caso, está en la posibilidad de crecer en [número de baterías](https://www.3djuegos.com/3djuegos-trivia/noticias/que-pilas-baterias-tienen-tantas-formas-disenos-distintos) creadas y energía almacenada para responder a la demanda cada vez más creciente de nuestra sociedad. Y si además lo hacemos dependiendo menos de los combustibles fósiles, pues mejor que mejor. Imagen | [Knyong en Midjourney](https://www.midjourney.com/jobs/95813d2d-0eb5-4cec-b439-39905e285be2?index=0) En 3DJuegos | [China ha superado los límites de la energía con una batería gigante tan grande como un edificio. Es capaz de cargar cientos de coches a la vez](https://www.3djuegos.com/3djuegos-trivia/noticias/china-ha-empujado-limites-baterias-creando-pila-grande-como-edificio-busqueda-energia-infinita-esta-cada-vez-cerca) En 3DJuegos | [A Japón le ha tocado la lotería de las baterías. Han encontrado una isla remota de Tokio con más de 200 millones de toneladas de metales raros](https://www.3djuegos.com/3djuegos-trivia/noticias/a-japon-le-acaba-tocar-loteria-baterias-ha-descubierto-isla-remota-tokio-200-millones-toneladas-metales-raros)

author: @Live_Hindustan
title: शिक्षक अन्य जिले भेज दिये गये, ई-शिक्षा कोष पर मुजफ्फरपुर का नाम
text:
Hindi News
Bihar News
Muzaffarpur NewsTeachers Resign from TRE Two to TRE Three Impact on E-Education Fund
शिक्षक अन्य जिले भेज दिये गये, ई-शिक्षा कोष पर मुजफ्फरपुर का नाम
मुजफ्फरपुर में टीआरई टू के दर्जनों शिक्षकों ने टीआरई थ्री में अन्य जिले में चयन के बाद त्यागपत्र दे दिया है। इससे ई-शिक्षा कोष पर उनका नाम होने के कारण संबंधित स्कूलों में नई रिक्तियों का निर्माण नहीं...
Newswrap
हिन्दुस्तान, मुजफ्फरपुरThu, 26 June 2025 05:40 PM
मुजफ्फरपुर, प्रमुख संवाददाता। टीआरई टू के नियुक्त दर्जनों शिक्षक टीआरई थ्री में अन्य जिले चले गए, लेकिन अबतक ई-शिक्षा कोष पर इनका नाम मुजफ्फरपुर जिले के स्कूलों का ही है। टीआरई टू में नियुक्त दर्जनों शिक्षकों ने टीआरई थ्री में अन्य जिला मिलने पर त्यागपत्र दे दिया है। विभिन्न स्कूलों के हेडमास्टर ने इसे लेकर गुहार लगाई है। अबतक ई-शिक्षा कोष पर नाम होने से इन स्कूलों में संबंधित विषयों में नई रिक्ति नहीं बन पा रही है। जिले के टीआरई टू के पांच दर्जन से अधिक शिक्षकों ने त्यागपत्र दे दिया है। इनमें बड़ी संख्या में ऐसे शिक्षक हैं, जिन्होंने अन्य जिला मिलने के कारण यह कदम उठाया है।
दो दर्जन से अधिक शिक्षक ऐसे हैं, जो इसी जिले में टीआरई थ्री में नियुक्त हुए हैं, लेकिन मिडिल से हाईस्कूल इनका कर दिया गया है। त्यागपत्र देनेवालों में छह से आठ के गणित-विज्ञान के शिक्षक अधिक: टीआरई टू में छह से आठ में गणित-विज्ञान विषय में चयनित अतीश कुमार कुमार कुढ़नी में पदस्थापित थे। टीआरई थ्री में दरभंगा में चयन के बाद इन्होंने 19 मई को त्यागपत्र दे दिया। इसी तरह शुभम कुमार का टीआरई टू में गणित विज्ञान में छह से आठ में साहेबगंज में चयन हुआ। टीआरई थ्री में मधुबनी में चयन के बाद इन्होंने 19 मई को त्यागपत्र दे दिया। रानी सुमन का टीआरई टू में छह से आठ में गणित विज्ञान में गायघाट में पदस्थापन हुआ। टीआरई थ्री में समस्तीपुर में चयन के बाद इन्होंने 15 मई को त्यागपत्र दे दिया। पारू में चयनित कुमारी नेहा, कटरा में चयनित मणिकांत कुमार, कांटी में चयनित सुप्रिया सुमन समेत दर्जनों शिक्षक छह से आठ में गणित विज्ञान विषय में पदस्थापित थे। इन सभी ने टीआरई थ्री में चयन के बाद मई में त्यागपत्र दे दिया। विभिन्न स्कूलों के हेडमास्टर ने कहा कि ये शिक्षक अब अन्य जिले में चले गए हैं। ऐसे में अगर इनका नाम ई-शिक्षा कोष से हटता है तो गणित विज्ञान विषय में रिक्ति फिर से बनेगी।
लेटेस्ट Hindi News ,
 बॉलीवुड न्यूज, बिजनेस न्यूज, टेक
, ऑटो, करियर , और राशिफल,
पढ़ने के लिए Live Hindustan App डाउनलोड करें।

author: Chris Enloe
title: Nikki Haley believes viral Civil War question was a set up: 'Definitely a Democrat plant' | Blaze Media
text: JOSEPH PREZIOSO/AFP via Getty Images © 2023 Blaze Media LLC. All rights reserved. Nikki Haley believes viral Civil War question was a set up: 'Definitely a Democrat plant' December 28, 2023 Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley alleged Thursday that the audience member [who asked her about the Civil War](https://www.theblaze.com/news/nikki-haley-cause-civil-war) at a town hall was a "Democrat plant." At a town hall in New Hampshire on Wednesday, an audience member asked Haley what caused the Civil War. The cause, Haley responded, "was basically how government was going to run the freedoms of what people could and couldn’t do." She then spoke about liberty, individual rights, and government — a response for which the audience member was apparently prepared. "In the year 2023, it's astonishing to me that you answered that question without mentioning the word 'slavery,'" the audience member told Haley. "What do you want me to say about slavery?" she responded. "You answered my question, thank you," the man replied. In a Thursday interview with a New Hampshire radio show, Haley responded to the bipartisan whiplash over her answer and acknowledged the obvious. "Of course, the Civil War was about slavery," she said, going on to clarify why she spoke about individual rights and the role of government. "Yes, I know it was about slavery. I'm from the South." The former South Carolina governor then alleged the audience member was planted by President Joe Biden and the Democratic Party to make her look bad. "Biden and the Democrats keep sending Democrat plants to do things like this, to get the media to react. We know when they're there. We know what they're doing," she said. According to Haley, the Democratic Party machine is targeting her because they believe she will handily defeat Biden in a general election and therefore want to sink her campaign to ensure that Donald Trump wins the Republican nomination. Haley, moreover, claimed she recognized the audience member as a "plant," which is why she tried to turn the question around on him. "It was definitely a Democrat plant," she [said](https://nhjournal.com/haley-civil-war-question-was-democrat-plant/). "That's why I said, 'What does it mean to you?' And if you notice, he didn’t answer anything. The same reason he didn't tell the reporters what his name was. The same reason he went and showed the guy that he was with the tweet that went up after he did it. "We see these guys when they come [to our events]. We know what they're doing, and we know from the second they ask the question. If you look at the last swing I did in New Hampshire, there was one at every single town hall. This is what they do. And I'm trying to turn the questions back on them," she said. Haley, however, did not offer any evidence to back her claims. According [to the New Hampshire Journal](https://nhjournal.com/haley-civil-war-question-was-democrat-plant/), the audience member later told reporters that he asked the question because he knew that Haley was asked the same question more than a decade ago and wanted to see how she would answer today. Like Blaze News? Bypass the censors, sign up for our newsletters, and get stories like this direct to your inbox. [Sign up here](https://www.theblaze.com/newsletters/theblaze-articlelink)! Want to leave a tip? We answer to you. Help keep our content free of advertisers and big tech censorship by leaving a tip today. Want to join the conversation? Already a subscriber?
